clinical_study.brief_title: Large Macular Hole Closure Rate With Amniotic Membrane Graft With and Without Limitorrhexis
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Macular Hole Closure Rate in Patients With Poor Prognosis Clinical Features Treated With Amniotic Membrane Graft With and Without Limitorrhexis

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Oftalmología Fundación Conde de Valenciana

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Oftalmología Fundación Conde de Valenciana

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with idiopathic macular holes (MHs) postoperative closure rates for large MHs (diameter > 550 μm) are disappointing and often require a second intervention, different techniques have been described with very variable success rates in different published studies, an efficient technique with good functional outcome has not been found.

detailed_description.textblock: Interventional study in large macular holes (diameter > 550 μm) using an amniotic membrane with and without internal limiting membrane peeling.

study_design_info.masking_description: We never let the patient know the performed surgery

primary_outcome.measure: % of macular hole clousure measured with OCT
primary_outcome.description: Closure of the macular hole by optical coherence tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Best-corrected visual acuity measured with Snellen Chart
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement of 2 lines in best-corrected visual acuity

secondary_outcome.measure: Superficial and deep retinal capillary plexus density with OCT-A
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of capillary plexus in macular hole area

arm_group.arm_group_label: Amniotic membrane without internal limiting membrane peeling
arm_group.description: The surgery performed will be phacoemulsification + vitrectomy using an amniotic membrane to plug the macular hole using air as tamponade.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Amniotic membrane with internal limiting membrane peeling
arm_group.description: The surgery performed will be phacoemulsification + vitrectomy + internal limiting membrane peeling using an amniotic membrane to plug the macular hole using air as tamponade.

intervention.intervention_name: Macular hole closure with amniotic membrane with/without internal limiting membrane peeling
intervention.description: Pars plana vitrectomy with/without internal limiting membrane peeling, amniotic membrane, and air tamponade
intervention.arm_group_label: Amniotic membrane with internal limiting membrane peeling
Amniotic membrane without internal limiting membrane peeling

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Not myopic patients (<6 Dioptre or <26 mm)
- Large macular hole >550 μm
- > 6 months symptoms
- Signing informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with other ocular disease (diabetic retinopathy, glaucoma, uveitis, ocular tumors, etc)
- Using systemic drugs that are toxic for the optic nerve or retina (chloroquine, hydroxychloroquine, tamoxifen, ethambutol, etc)
- Patients with ocular surgery
